isis.stitle: AIR CONDITIONING - HEATER SYSTEM: 9000 Pro Sleeper After 05/01/1997, and 9800 Model After 07/01/1997 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - BLOWER MOTOR ASSEMBLY - Sleeper Compartment (92/93/94/9900)

figure.caption: Figure 43. Blower Motor Assembly - Sleeper Compartment (92/93/94/9900)

step1.para: Make sure the key switch and blower motor switches are in the OFF position.
Remove seat belt restraining bracket from passenger side trim panel.
Remove screws from lower passenger side trim panel to gain access to the sleeper compartment blower.
Remove the section of air duct that connects the blend air unit to the blower motor assembly.
Disconnect the electrical connector(s) from the blower motor assembly.
Remove the three bolts from the blower motor assembly mounting flange.
Raise the blower motor assembly and tilt it outward to remove.
If removed, install the duct to the blower motor assembly.
Tilt the blower motor and duct assembly toward the duct enclosure and slide the assembly into position. Make sure the blower motor duct engages the duct in the enclosure.
Install and tighten the bolts in the blower motor assembly mounting flange.
Connect the electrical connector(s) to the blower motor assembly.
Install and tighten the mounting screws for the duct section between the blower motor and the blend air unit.
Carefully position the trim panel around the duct and install the screws.
Install the seat belt restraining bracket.
